channel.title: Pages on OSMANA-STATS
channel.description: Recent content in Pages on OSMANA-STATS

item.title: About
item.description: Welcom to Oxford Stein’s Method and Network Analysis (OSMANA) research group in the Department of Statistics.

item.title: Members
item.description: Faculties Professor Gesine Reinert I am a University Professor in Statistics, and also a Fellow of Keble College. I am also a Fellow of the Alan Turing Institute. Professor Mihai Cucuringu I am an Associate Professor in the Department of Statistics, and an Affiliate Faculty in the Mathematical Institute at University of Oxford. I am also a Stipendiary Lecturer in Statistics at Merton College, University of Oxford, a Turing Fellow at The Alan Turing Institute in London, and a Senior Research Fellow at the Institute for New Economic Thinking at the Oxford Martin School.

item.title: Publications
item.description: Stein’s Method Exponential Random Graph Models Graph Time-Series Graph Representation Learning

item.title: Talks and Research
item.description: We are interested in a wide spectrum of problems and applications related to probability, statistics, Stein’s method, and network analysis. We hold Reading Groups and events regarding graph representation learning and machine learning methods to better tackle our problems.
